page.title: 16HIGHWAYS DEPARTMENT DRAYTON
page.content: Situated in the NW of the area is the Drayton Highways Depot one of the six depots within the County managed by the County Surveyor on behalf of West Sussex County Council. They are responsible for the maintenance of 4 thousand miles of road, 6 million sq metres of footway and have 80 staff. Stores, materials, tools and machinery kept on site. Ambulances, School Buses and Cars owned by WSCC are serviced at the Depot. All road signs are made on site from fluorescent materials and wooden signs carved for footpaths, etc. They have to deal with emergencies such as fallen trees, oil pollution and iced roads (3 thousand tons of salt used on the roads winter 1984). WSCC finance but Government pay for road gritting during winter and claims are made for damage where appropriate.
